alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Crowley County; La Junta Vicinity, Otero County; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Pikes Peak, Teller County and the Rampart Range, Fremont County, the northern Sangre De Cristo and Wet Mountains, the Wet Mountain Valley and El Paso, Pueblo, Crowley and Otero counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms capable of producing intense rainfall rates will remain possible over the mountains and adjacent locations across the plains this evening. Burn scars and urban areas will be most prone to flash flooding. However, flooding will also be possible where storms redevelop over or near steep terrain, or for locations that receive repeated rounds of heavy rainfall. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
